intro: Rubus × cerinostylus, commonly known as the smooth-chinned blackberry. It is a hybrid species within the Rubus genus, characterized by its thornless stems and large, dark purple to black berries. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and prefers well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. This cultivar is prized for its sweet flavor and is often used in jams and desserts.
